page.title: 02THE LANDSCAPE
page.content:
The area mainly consists of gently {undulating ground}rising to{120-130m.} Most of the soils are of glacial origin and were created by extensive deposition of{sands, clays and gravels as ice melted at the end of the Ice Age.
There is a{broad, flat floored {valley}running in a N.N.W-S.S.E direction towards the south-western margin of the area. This may well have been formed by glacial melt-water. Man has made use of this{natural routeway since it is occupied by the{Shropshire {Union Canal (Llangollen Branch).}The canal is a major feature of this sparsely populated area.
